Subject: Email Alert for License Renewal After Importing
Description:
We imported our new licenses yesterday, on 4/17/2025, but we received another email alert this morning with the subject "Action Required: Subscription License Renewal Notice - Endpoint Protector". Our previous license expiration date was 4/19/2025, and the correct date is now listed in the web interface, being 4/19/2028. 

Are there any additional steps we need to take to avoid any service interruptions? Also, why would we still be receiving the renewal notice after importing the new licenses?
What_We_Know__c:
4/25/2025

- Joined remote session
- Sent customer Zoom link
- Customer did not join remote session
- Waited 15 minutes and ended remote session
- Sent customer follow up email requesting available dates next week

4/18/2025

- Customer issued a reboot for the EPP Appliance yesterday
- Emails are still being received another email for the license renewal this morning
- Asked solutions channel on how to stop emails
- Sent customer email with current status of checking for answers internally and requesting available days and times to schedule a remote session
- Informed team regarding issue
- Sent customer meeting invitation for Friday 25 April at 3 PM CST


4/17/2025

- Emailed customer and informed him that cron job that is set to reset licenses possibly has not run yet. Requested screen shots of licensing page before and after reboot. Also to see if issue reoccurs after reboot. 

- Customer stated that he will reboot the EPP server tonight and will let me know tomorrow if the issue is still present
Solution_Comment__c:
Customer reports that emails reporting license expiration has stopped
Verified that the EPP UI Licensing page shows the license set to expire on 2028
Closing ticket since the emails have stopped
